titleStmt.title: Letter, Mrs. Oscar Barthold in Weatherford, Texas, to Elizabeth Ramsey Breck in Knoxville, Tenn.1902 Nov. 17

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, Mrs. Oscar Barthold in Weatherford, Texas, to Elizabeth Ramsey Breck in Knoxville, Tenn. 1902 Nov. 17
bibl.note: 1902 Nov. 17, Mrs. Oscar Barthold, Weatherford, Texas, to Elizabeth Ramsey Breck, Knoxville, Tenn. Requests a copy of the family Bible record. Speaks of her growing interest in her Alexander ancestors and in Dr. Ramsey.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I hope you will not think me presumptuous in troubling you again about my questions along the Alexander line. You will doubtless remember my visit to you

in regard to John McKnitt Alexander; - You spoke of the family bible record I am very desirous of a copy of said record remembering how smart and kind you were to me I make bold my request for a copy as it will be of great value to me the man I
read and know of your illustrious father the man I wish to know.
Hoping you are enjoying excellent health, and thanking you in advance for said information
